thread.section_title: Stock Market & Finance News - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Investor Who Won Big Betting on Housing Collapse Falters With China Bets

author: Chelsey Dulaney
title: Investor Who Won Big Betting on Housing Collapse Falters With China Bets
text:
A decade after the financial crisis, The Wall Street Journal has checked in on dozens of the bankers, government officials, chief executives, hedge-fund managers and others who left a mark on that period to find out what they are doing now. Today, we spotlight former Treasury Department administratorNeel Kashkari and hedge-fund manager Kyle Bass.
Kyle Bass made his name betting on the collapse of the U.S. housing market a decade ago. His latest attempt to profit from what he sees as a speculative bubble—this time in China’s...
